wms_article_body.body: GS Group has become the last of South Korea’s top 10 conglomerates to announce a corporate value-up plan under the Korea Exchange’s initiative. According to the Korea Exchange on Sunday, GS Corp., the group’s holding company, disclosed its plan last week. With this, at least one listed affiliate of each top 10 conglomerate has now released a corporate value-up plan. In its disclosure, GS pledged to distribute at least 40 percent of separate net income as dividends over the next three years and to target a return on equity (ROE) of 8 to 10 percent. The 49 companies among the top 10 conglomerates that have disclosed value-up plans represent 51.3 percent of their combined market capitalization. With GS now on board, attention has turned to Samsung Electronics Co., considered pivotal to the success of the policy, as most of Korea’s top market-cap companies have already disclosed plans. Analysts say the participation of the country’s No. 1 listed firm could prove decisive in driving momentum for the initiative.
